intro: Delissea glabra, commonly known as the smooth delissea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, often arranged in whorls along the stem. Delissea glabra thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and prolonged blooming period.
